verse.roman:
tataḥ phālgunam āsādya
pañcāpsarasam uttamam
viṣṇuḥ sannihito yatra
snātvāsparśad gavāyutam

synonyms: tataḥ—then; phālgunam—Phālguna; āsādya—reaching; pañca-apsarasam—the lake of the five Apsarās; uttamam—exalted; viṣṇuḥ—the Supreme Lord, Viṣṇu; sannihitaḥ—manifested; yatra—wherein; snātvā—bathing; asparśat—He touched (as part of the ritual in giving as charity); gava—cows; ayutam—ten thousand.
translation: Next He went to Phālguna-tīrtha and bathed in the sacred Pañcāpsarā Lake, where Lord Viṣṇu had directly manifested Himself. At this place He gave away another ten thousand cows.
